intro: Neobartsia tricolor, commonly known as the three-color bartsia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its strikingly colored flowers, which typically display three distinct colors on each bloom. It grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and forest floors. Neobartsia tricolor is often found in association with other shade-tolerant flora, contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
